title: Understanding the DISTINCT Clause
text: The DISTINCT clause is used in SQL to filter out duplicate records from the results of a query. It ensures that the output contains only unique values.

title: When to Use DISTINCT
text: Use the DISTINCT clause when you want to retrieve only unique values from a column in a database table. This is particularly useful when you want to eliminate duplicate entries.

title: Applying the DISTINCT Clause
text: Consider a table with a column 'City' that contains the following values: New York, Los Angeles, New York, Chicago. What would be the result of using the DISTINCT clause on the 'City' column?
choices: New York, Los Angeles, New York, Chicago

title: Syntax of the DISTINCT Clause
text: The syntax for using the DISTINCT clause in a SQL query is: SELECT DISTINCT $$column_{name}$$ FROM $$table_{name}$$
